AK::StreamMgr::IAkLowLevelIOHookBase interface for Low-Level I/O hooks. Defines common methods across both types of hooks
AkAmbientUse this component to attach a Wwise Event to any object in a scene. The sound can be started at various moments, dependent on the selected Unity trigger. This component is more useful for ambient sounds (sounds related to scene-bound objects) but could also be used for other purposes

AkAudioFormatDefines the parameters of an audio buffer format
AkAudioListenerAdd this script on the game object that represent an audio listener. It will track its position in Wwise. This is normally added to the Camera object or the Player object

AkAuxSendValueAuxiliary bus sends information per game object per given auxilliary bus
AkBankLoads and unloads a soundbank at the specified moment
AkBankManagerMaintains the list of soundbanks loaded. This is currently used only with AkAmbient objects
AkBankPathUtilThis class is used for returning correct path strings for retrieving the soundbank file locations. The class makes path string retrieval transparent for all platforms in all contexts. Clients of the class only needs to use the public methods to get physically correct path strings after setting flag isToUsePosixPathSeparator. By default, the flag is turned off for non-buildPipeline usecases

AkEnvironmentUse this component to define a reverb zone. This needs to be added to a collider object to work properly
AkEnvironment::AkEnvironment_CompareBySelectionAlgorithm
AkEnvironmentPortalUse this component to define an area that straddles two different AkEnvironments zones and allow mixing between both zones
AkEventHelper class that knows a Wwise Event and when to trigger it in Unity

AkEventCallbackMsgEvent callback information. Event callback functions can receive this structure as a parameter

AkFileDesc
AkFileParser::EnvelopePointAnalyzed envelope point
AkFileSystemFlagsFile system flags for file descriptors mapping
AkGameObjThis component represents a sound emitter in your scene. It will track its position and other game syncs such as Switches, RTPC and environment values. You can add this to any object that will emit sound. Note that if it is not present, Wwise will add it automatically, with the default values, to any Unity Game Object that is passed to Wwise API (see AkSoundEngine.cs)
